resources.string:
Scores the highest points possible rolling the dices to complete the 13 categories available in the game

A game consists of rounds during which the player has to choose which score category wants to use

Once a category has been used, it can't be used again

The game finishes when all the categories are completed

The winner is the player that scores the highest points
The dices can be rolled 3 times in a turn
You can lock the dices after the first or second roll
By the third roll you have to choose a category on the score board
[1â€“6]: Get as many dice as possible with this face. The score is the sum of these specific dices
Tris and Poker: 3 and 4 dices with the same face. The score is the sum of all the dices
Full: 3 dices of the same type and 2 of another type. The score is 25 points
Small Straight: 4 dices in ascending order. The score is 30 points
Large Straight: 5 dices in ascending order. The score is 40 points
Yahtzee: 5 equal dices. The score is 50 points. If Yahtzee is repeated, it can be inserted in another free category assigning 50 points
Chance: any combination. The points is the sum of all the dices
Bonus: it is obtained when the sum of the scores for the 6 previous combinations exceeds or reaches 63. The score is 35 points
